alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Grayson; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 2:22PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Wythe, southwestern Carroll and eastern Grayson Counties and the City of Galax through 300 PM EDT... At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cripple Creek, or near Speedwell, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Galax... Fries... Byllesby... Cripple Creek... Baywood... Elk Creek... and Spring Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
